section.p: By organizing content into topics that are written to be reusable, authors can achieve several goals:

ul.li: Topic-oriented information design ensures that each unit of information can be read independently.
Content can be organized differently for online and print delivery.
Content can be reused in different collections. Topics permit authors to refactor information as needed, including only the topics that apply to each unique scenario.
Content is more manageable in topic form whether managed as individual files in a traditional file system or as objects in a content management system.
Content authored in topics can be translated and updated more efficiently and less expensively.
Content authored in topics can be filtered more efficiently.
